description: Write n = K^2*F where F is squarefree and F = g*f where g = gcd(K,F) and f = F/g; then a(n) = f(n) = F(n)/g(n). Thus gcd(K^2,f) = 1.
comments: Differs from A007913; they coincide if and only if g(n) = 1.a(n) is powerfree part of n, i.e. if n=Product(pi^ei) over all i [prime factorization) then a(n)=Product(pi^ei) over those i with ei=1; if n=b*c^2*d^3 then a(n) is minimum possible value of b. - _Henry Bottomley_, Sep 01 2000Also denominator of n/rad(n)^2, where rad is the squarefree kernel of n (A007947), numerator: A062378. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 10 2002Largest unitary squarefree number dividing n (the unitary squarefree kernel of n). - _Steven Finch_, Mar 01 2004
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) = n/A057521(n)Multiplicative with a(p)=p and a(p^e)=1 for e>1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Nov 01 2001Dirichlet g.f. zeta(s)*product_{primes p} (1+p^(1-s) -p^(-s) -p^(1-2s) +p^(-2s)). - _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 21 2011
maple: A055231 := proc(n)    a := 1 ;    if n > 1 then        for f in ifactors(n)[2] do            if op(2, f) = 1 then                a := a*op(1, f) ;            end if;        end do:    end if;    a ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 23 2011
mathematica: rad[n_] := Times @@ First /@ FactorInteger[n]; a[n_] := Denominator[n/rad[n]^2]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 80}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jun 20 2013, after _Reinhard Zumkeller_ *)
prog: (PARI) A055231(n)={   local(a=1);   f=factor(n) ;   for(i=1,matsize(f)[1],         if( f[i,2] ==1, a *=  f[i,1]         )   ) ;   a ;} /* _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 12 2012 */
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 21 2000
